intro: Veronica ruthenica, commonly known as the Carpathian speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features small, blue or purple flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a slightly hairy texture. Veronica ruthenica is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in rocky or woodland soils. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
